page.title: 09 FORESTRY
page.content: The two biggest forest areas are Cann Woods and Newham Deer Park Forest.Newnham Forest is privately owned.Cann Woods is leased from the Earl of Morley and managed by the Forestry Commission.The National Trust own the Plym Valley Woodlands. In Cann Woods,Japanese larch and Douglas fir are the two most common trees.Larch is used mainly for fenceing.Grand fir,sitka spuce,red cedar,sequoya,and hemlock are also grown in Cann Woods.Some English hardwoods are grown.Oak,beech and sweet chestnut improve the forest as a habitat for wildlife. Trees are thinned out and the timber used for paletts,pit props and fence posts.Some wood is taken to the South Molton Chip Mill to make chipboard or is exported to other countries to be pulped for paper.
